name: California
description: California allows patients with qualifying medical conditions to apply for a medical card. The state has a well-established program covering a wide range of conditions including chronic pain, epilepsy, and cancer.

name: Colorado
description: Colorado offers a medical card program with some of the lowest fees in the country. Patients must have a qualifying condition certified by a licensed physician.

name: Florida
description: Florida's medical card program requires patients to be evaluated by a qualified physician. The state covers conditions such as PTSD, ALS, Crohn's disease, and glaucoma.

name: Illinois
description: Illinois provides medical cards for patients with debilitating conditions. The application process includes a physician certification and background check.

name: Massachusetts
description: Massachusetts has a medical card program administered by the Cannabis Control Commission. Patients need a certification from a registered healthcare provider.

name: Michigan
description: Michigan offers medical cards through its Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs. Qualifying conditions include chronic pain, seizures, and severe nausea.

name: Nevada
description: Nevada's medical card program is managed by the Department of Health and Human Services. Patients can apply online after receiving a physician recommendation.

name: New York
description: New York's medical program covers a broad range of conditions. Patients must be certified by a registered practitioner and can apply through the state's health department.

name: Ohio
description: Ohio's medical card program requires patients to visit a certified physician. The state covers conditions including Alzheimer's, cancer, and traumatic brain injury.

name: Oregon
description: Oregon has one of the oldest medical card programs in the country. The Oregon Health Authority manages the application process and renewals.

name: Pennsylvania
description: Pennsylvania offers medical cards through its Department of Health. Patients must be diagnosed with one of 23 qualifying conditions by an approved practitioner.

name: Texas
description: Texas has a limited medical program known as the Compassionate Use Program. It covers a smaller set of conditions compared to other states but has no card fee.

name: Arizona
description: Arizona's medical card program is managed by the Department of Health Services. Patients must submit a physician certification along with their application.

name: Washington
description: Washington state provides medical cards with minimal fees. The program is overseen by the Department of Health and covers a variety of qualifying conditions.

name: New Jersey
description: New Jersey's medical card program has expanded significantly in recent years. Patients can register online after receiving a physician's recommendation.
